examples: to attempt an escape from prison
I attempted to sing, but my throat was too hoarse.
A group of 80 budding mountaineers attempted Kilimanjaro, but 30 of them didn’t make it to the top.

definitions.definition: To try to move, by entreaty, by afflictions, or by temptations; to tempt.
To try to win, subdue, or overcome.
examples: one who attempts the virtue of a woman

definitions.definition: To attack; to make an effort or attack upon; to try to take by force.
To make a substantial but unsuccessful effort (to commit a crime ).

secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) To try to move, by entreaty, by afflictions, or by temptations; to tempt.
( archaic ) To try to win, subdue, or overcome.
( archaic ) To attack; to make an effort or attack upon; to try to take by force.
( criminal law ) To make a substantial but unsuccessful effort (to commit a crime ).
